Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of an orange pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and partially pink in section, the interior is slightly ribbed, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now worn in parts, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.206)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36495) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36495)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 359 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
